Albert HARRIS
v.
GUARANTY INCOME LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY.
No. 41200.
Supreme Court of Louisiana.
July 2, 1954.
Rehearing Denied October 5, 1954.
*228 Irving Ward-Steinman, Alexandria, for plaintiff-appellant.
Gamble & Gamble, New Orleans, for defendant-appellee.
HAWTHORNE, Justice.
Plaintiff Albert Harris, the beneficiary named in an insurance policy on the life of his deceased mother, Mrs. Henriette Dufour Mayeux, issued by the Guaranty Income Life Insurance Company in the principal amount of $5,000, instituted this suit to recover the face amount of this policy. After trial on the merits there was judgment rejecting his demands and dismissing his suit, and he has appealed.
The insurance policy in the instant case was dated May 4, 1949, and called for an annual premium of $261.35. The premium for the second year, which fell due on May 4, 1950, was not paid, and the policy lapsed for nonpayment of this annual premium. After the policy lapsed, the agent or solicitor of the defendant insurance company called upon the plaintiff three or four times in an effort to have him reinstate the policy on the life of his mother, but the plaintiff beneficiary informed him that he did not have sufficient funds available for this purpose, although the record discloses that he owned property at that time having a value of approximately $75,000.
